plugin.name: HP Fortify SCA Plugin for Maven 2 and 3:

mojo.description: This goal clears out a build ID, potentially for re-use in a subsequent analysis.

parameter.name: buildId
parameter.description: build Id - will default to project name and version. If you are running an aggregate build use the -Dfortify.sca.buildId commandline configuration option instead to set the buildId for all modules.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will run in debug mode which is useful during troubleshooting

parameter.name: dontRunSCA
parameter.description: Collect commands to be run, but do not actually run them.

parameter.name: jre64
parameter.description: Runs Fortify SCA inside the 64-bit JRE. If no 64-bit JRE is available, Fortify SCA fails.

parameter.name: logfile
parameter.description: The log file to be produced by sourceanalyzer.

parameter.name: machineOutput
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: maxHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 600 MB (-Xmx600M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When specifying this option, ensure that you do not allocate more memory than is physically available, because this degrades performance. As a guideline, assuming no other memory intensive processes are running, do not allocate more than 2/3 of the available memory.

parameter.name: maxPermGen
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum permanent space size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The permanent space is the third part of Java memory, where are stored classes, methods etc. The default maximum value for the permanent generation is 64 MB (-XX:MaxPermSize=64M). The permanent space is allocated as a separate memory region from the java heap, so increasing the permanent space will increase the overall memory requirements for the process.

parameter.name: minHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the initial and minimum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 300MB (-Xms300M), which can be sufficient in most of cases.

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will write minimal messages to the console

parameter.name: scanEnabled
parameter.description: Set scanEnabled to false for any project that should not be scanned.

parameter.name: scaPropertiesFile
parameter.description: The location of a .properties file, the contents of which are property-value pairs that are to be passed to sourceanalyzer in the form of -Dproperty=value, e.g. -Dcom.fortify.sca.DefaultJarsDirs=default_jar:../mylibs and -Dcom.fortify.sca.limiters.MaxChainDepth=10. Said file should be a standard Java properties file; refer to the Java documentation for more info on what this entails. Note that properties set in this manner will often take preference over Maven plug-in configuration properties such as defaultJarsPathString.

parameter.name: sourceanalyzer
parameter.description: location of the sourceanalyzer executable. Defaults to sourceanalyzer which will run the version on the path or fail if non exists.

parameter.name: stackSize
parameter.description: Specifies the thread stack size of JVM runs Fortify SCA. Thread stacks are memory areas allocated for each Java thread for their internal use. The defaul value is 1MB (-Xss1M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When encountering java.lang.StackOverflowError, increase the value gradually. For example, -Xss4M, -Xss8M.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will print its version

mojo.description: Delete all generated Java sources from each project that is marked scanEnabled.

parameter.name: buildId
parameter.description: build Id - will default to project name and version. If you are running an aggregate build use the -Dfortify.sca.buildId commandline configuration option instead to set the buildId for all modules.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will run in debug mode which is useful during troubleshooting

parameter.name: dontRunSCA
parameter.description: Collect commands to be run, but do not actually run them.

parameter.description: Runs Fortify SCA inside the 64-bit JRE. If no 64-bit JRE is available, Fortify SCA fails.

When specifying this option, ensure that you do not allocate more memory than is physically available, because this degrades performance. As a guideline, assuming no other memory intensive processes are running, do not allocate more than 2/3 of the available memory.

parameter.description: Specifies the maximum permanent space size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The permanent space is the third part of Java memory, where are stored classes, methods etc. The default maximum value for the permanent generation is 64 MB (-XX:MaxPermSize=64M). The permanent space is allocated as a separate memory region from the java heap, so increasing the permanent space will increase the overall memory requirements for the process.

parameter.description: Specifies the initial and minimum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 300MB (-Xms300M), which can be sufficient in most of cases.

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will write minimal messages to the console

parameter.name: scanEnabled
parameter.description: Set scanEnabled to false for any project that should not be scanned.

parameter.name: scaPropertiesFile
parameter.description: The location of a .properties file, the contents of which are property-value pairs that are to be passed to sourceanalyzer in the form of -Dproperty=value, e.g. -Dcom.fortify.sca.DefaultJarsDirs=default_jar:../mylibs and -Dcom.fortify.sca.limiters.MaxChainDepth=10. Said file should be a standard Java properties file; refer to the Java documentation for more info on what this entails. Note that properties set in this manner will often take preference over Maven plug-in configuration properties such as defaultJarsPathString.

parameter.name: sourceanalyzer
parameter.description: location of the sourceanalyzer executable. Defaults to sourceanalyzer which will run the version on the path or fail if non exists.

The defaul value is 1MB (-Xss1M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When encountering java.lang.StackOverflowError, increase the value gradually. For example, -Xss4M, -Xss8M.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will print its version

mojo.description: Requires SCA 360 v2.5+. Only use with WebLogic.

parameter.name: buildId
parameter.description: build Id - will default to project name and version. If you are running an aggregate build use the -Dfortify.sca.buildId commandline configuration option instead to set the buildId for all modules.

parameter.name: debug

parameter.description: Runs Fortify SCA inside the 64-bit JRE. If no 64-bit JRE is available, Fortify SCA fails.

parameter.name: machineOutput
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: maxHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 600 MB (-Xmx600M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. Said file should be a standard Java properties file; refer to the Java documentation for more info on what this entails. Note that properties set in this manner will often take preference over Maven plug-in configuration properties such as defaultJarsPathString.

parameter.name: sourceanalyzer
parameter.description: location of the sourceanalyzer executable. Defaults to sourceanalyzer which will run the version on the path or fail if non exists.

parameter.description: Specifies the thread stack size of JVM runs Fortify SCA. Thread stacks are memory areas allocated for each Java thread for their internal use. The defaul value is 1MB (-Xss1M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When encountering java.lang.StackOverflowError, increase the value gradually. For example, -Xss4M, -Xss8M.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will print its version

mojo.description: Perform the scan step on a particular build ID. Optionally, upload results to Software Security Center.

parameter.name: buildId
parameter.description: build Id - will default to project name and version. If you are running an aggregate build use the -Dfortify.sca.buildId commandline configuration option instead to set the buildId for all modules.

parameter.name: buildLabel
parameter.description: Build Label inserted in to generated FPR

parameter.name: buildProject
parameter.description: Build Project Name inserted in to generated FPR

parameter.name: buildVersion
parameter.description: Build Version inserted in to generated FPR

parameter.name: debug
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will run in debug mode which is useful during troubleshooting

parameter.name: dontRunSCA
parameter.description: Collect commands to be run, but do not actually run them.

parameter.name: f360AuthToken
parameter.description: AnalysisUploadToken to use when attempting to upload fpr files to Software Security Center

parameter.name: f360Url
parameter.description: SSC url to interact with during uplaod actions

parameter.name: failOnSCAError
parameter.description: If set to false the plugin will try to continue past individual SCA scan invocation failures. This is useful to get an initial scan or when you are doing a component by component scan of a project tree. Set this to true when performing an aggregate scan.

parameter.name: failOnUploadError
parameter.description: If set to false the plugin will try to continue past individual scan upload failures.

parameter.name: filter
parameter.description: Filter file to use when performing a scan

parameter.name: findbugs
parameter.description: If true include FindBugs analysis results in the final report

parameter.name: fortifyclient
parameter.description: location of the fortifyclient executable. Defaults to fortifyclient which will run the version on the path, uploads will fail if non exists.

parameter.name: htmlReport
parameter.description: If true an html report summary of results is produced

parameter.name: jre64
parameter.description: Runs Fortify SCA inside the 64-bit JRE. If no 64-bit JRE is available, Fortify SCA fails.

parameter.name: logfile
parameter.description: Specifies the log file that is produced by Fortify SCA.

parameter.name: machineOutput
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: maxHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 600 MB (-Xmx600M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When specifying this option, ensure that you do not allocate more memory than is physically available, because this degrades performance. As a guideline, assuming no other memory intensive processes are running, do not allocate more than 2/3 of the available memory.

parameter.name: maxPermGen
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum permanent space size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The permanent space is the third part of Java memory, where are stored classes, methods etc. The default maximum value for the permanent generation is 64 MB (-XX:MaxPermSize=64M). The permanent space is allocated as a separate memory region from the java heap, so increasing the permanent space will increase the overall memory requirements for the process.

parameter.name: minHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the initial and minimum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 300MB (-Xms300M), which can be sufficient in most of cases.

parameter.name: projectId
parameter.description: Project ID of the project in Software Security Center used if upload is set to true. Note that projectId will override projectName, projectVersion combinations if supplied.

parameter.name: projectName
parameter.description: Project Name of the project in Software Security Center used if upload is set to true. Note that this must be supplied in conjunction with projectVersion.

parameter.name: projectVersion
parameter.description: Project Version of the project in Software Security Center used if upload is set to true. Note that this must be supplied in conjunction with projectName.

parameter.name: quickScan
parameter.description: Scans the project in Quick Scan Mode, using the fortifysca-quickscan.properties file. By default, this scan searches for high-confidence, high-severity issues

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will write minimal messages to the console

parameter.name: renderSources
parameter.description: Source files are not included in the FPR file if set to false.

parameter.name: resultsFile
parameter.description: Location and name of the generated FPR file

parameter.name: rules
parameter.description: Rules files to use when performing a scan. Use an outer <rules> tag followed by nested <rule> tags to specify one or more rules files to use when performing the scan.

parameter.name: scanEnabled
parameter.description: Set scanEnabled to false for any project that should not be scanned.

parameter.name: scaPropertiesFile
parameter.description: The location of a .properties file, the contents of which are property-value pairs that are to be passed to sourceanalyzer in the form of -Dproperty=value, e.g. -Dcom.fortify.sca.DefaultJarsDirs=default_jar:../mylibs and -Dcom.fortify.sca.limiters.MaxChainDepth=10. Said file should be a standard Java properties file; refer to the Java documentation for more info on what this entails. Note that properties set in this manner will often take preference over Maven plug-in configuration properties such as defaultJarsPathString.

parameter.name: sourceanalyzer
parameter.description: location of the sourceanalyzer executable. Defaults to sourceanalyzer which will run the version on the path or fail if non exists.

parameter.name: stackSize
parameter.description: Specifies the thread stack size of JVM runs Fortify SCA. Thread stacks are memory areas allocated for each Java thread for their internal use. The defaul value is 1MB (-Xss1M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When encountering java.lang.StackOverflowError, increase the value gradually. For example, -Xss4M, -Xss8M.

parameter.name: toplevelArtifactId
parameter.description: For aggregate builds it is necessary to use the -Dfortify.sca.toplevel.artifactId commandline configuration to ensure that all code for modules (sub-projects) built are added under a single buildId and hence analyzed together. Otherwise each sub-module will be assigned its own default buildId

parameter.name: upload
parameter.description: if true, the plugin will attempt to upload the result of the scan to Software Security Center

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will print its version

mojo.description: Translate your application to a particular build ID.

parameter.name: appserver
parameter.description: Specifies the application server for processing JSP files: weblogic or websphere.

parameter.name: appserverHome
parameter.description: Specifies the application server's home. For Weblogic, this is the path to the directory containing the server/lib directory. For WebSphere, this is the path to the directory containing the bin/JspBatchCompiler script.

parameter.name: appserverVersion
parameter.description: Specifies the version of the application server. For Weblogic, valid values are 7, 8, 9, and 10. For WebSphere, the valid value is 6.

parameter.name: buildId
parameter.description: build Id - will default to project name and version. If you are running an aggregate build use the -Dfortify.sca.buildId commandline configuration option instead to set the buildId for all modules.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will run in debug mode which is useful during troubleshooting

parameter.name: defaultJarsPathString
parameter.description: Specifies a string to be passed to sca via the -Dcom.fortify.sca.DefaultJarsDirs command-line property definition. This string is expected to be a properly formatted OS dependent list of paths relative to the ScA install Core directory. No processing is done on this string. Potentially useful for JSP compilation.

parameter.name: dontRunSCA
parameter.description: Collect commands to be run, but do not actually run them.

parameter.name: encoding
parameter.description: Specifies the source file encoding type. This option is the same as the javac encoding option.

parameter.name: exclude
parameter.description: Specifies the file path to exclude from translation..

parameter.name: extraClassPathString
parameter.description: Specifies a string to be added to the end of -cp sca command-line option. This is in addition to dependencies worked out from the pom. This should be a correctly formed and separated list of paths for the underlying system. No processing is done on this string other than concatenation. Potentially useful for JSP compilation.

parameter.name: failOnSCAError
parameter.description: If set to false the plugin will try to continue past individual SCA translate invocation failures. Translate invocations may fail legitimately. For example if there are no files in src/main/java for a jar project. Set this to true during your verification step but false during your normal runs.

parameter.name: jre64
parameter.description: Runs Fortify SCA inside the 64-bit JRE. If no 64-bit JRE is available, Fortify SCA fails.

parameter.name: logfile
parameter.description: Specifies the log file that is produced by Fortify SCA.

parameter.name: machineOutput
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: maxHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 600 MB (-Xmx600M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When specifying this option, ensure that you do not allocate more memory than is physically available, because this degrades performance. As a guideline, assuming no other memory intensive processes are running, do not allocate more than 2/3 of the available memory.

parameter.name: maxPermGen
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum permanent space size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The permanent space is the third part of Java memory, where are stored classes, methods etc. The default maximum value for the permanent generation is 64 MB (-XX:MaxPermSize=64M). The permanent space is allocated as a separate memory region from the java heap, so increasing the permanent space will increase the overall memory requirements for the process.

parameter.name: minHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the initial and minimum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 300MB (-Xms300M), which can be sufficient in most of cases.

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will write minimal messages to the console

parameter.name: scanEnabled
parameter.description: Set scanEnabled to false for any project that should not be scanned.

parameter.name: scaPropertiesFile
parameter.description: The location of a .properties file, the contents of which are property-value pairs that are to be passed to sourceanalyzer in the form of -Dproperty=value, e.g. -Dcom.fortify.sca.DefaultJarsDirs=default_jar:../mylibs and -Dcom.fortify.sca.limiters.MaxChainDepth=10. Said file should be a standard Java properties file; refer to the Java documentation for more info on what this entails. Note that properties set in this manner will often take preference over Maven plug-in configuration properties such as defaultJarsPathString.

parameter.name: skipTests
parameter.description: If set to true tests are also included in the analysis. It defaults to the maven.test.skip value or can be set independently for sca.

parameter.name: source
parameter.description: Indicates which version of the JDK the Java code is written for. Valid values for version are 1.3, 1.4, 1.5, 1.6. and 1.7

parameter.name: sourceanalyzer
parameter.description: location of the sourceanalyzer executable. Defaults to sourceanalyzer which will run the version on the path or fail if non exists.

parameter.name: sourcePath
parameter.description: Directory containing source files to be used for name resolution. These files are not to be analyzed.

parameter.name: stackSize
parameter.description: Specifies the thread stack size of JVM runs Fortify SCA. Thread stacks are memory areas allocated for each Java thread for their internal use. The defaul value is 1MB (-Xss1M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When encountering java.lang.StackOverflowError, increase the value gradually. For example, -Xss4M, -Xss8M.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will print its version

parameter.name: warOutputDirectory
parameter.description: Location of the exploded war directory. Only necessary for packaging of type war and then only if the default location of the exploded war directory has been overridden by the webappDirectory war plugin configuration parameter.

mojo.description: Upload result to Software Security Center.

parameter.name: buildId
parameter.description: build Id - will default to project name and version. If you are running an aggregate build use the -Dfortify.sca.buildId commandline configuration option instead to set the buildId for all modules.

parameter.name: debug
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will run in debug mode which is useful during troubleshooting

parameter.name: dontRunSCA
parameter.description: Collect commands to be run, but do not actually run them.

parameter.name: f360AuthToken
parameter.description: AnalysisUploadToken to use when attempting to upload fpr files to Software Security Center

parameter.name: f360Url
parameter.description: SSC url to interact with during uplaod actions

parameter.name: failOnUploadError
parameter.description: If set to false the plugin will try to continue past individual scan upload failures.

parameter.name: fortifyclient
parameter.description: location of the fortifyclient executable. Defaults to fortifyclient which will run the version on the path, uploads will fail if non exists.

parameter.name: jre64
parameter.description: Runs Fortify SCA inside the 64-bit JRE. If no 64-bit JRE is available, Fortify SCA fails.

parameter.name: machineOutput
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: maxHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 600 MB (-Xmx600M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When specifying this option, ensure that you do not allocate more memory than is physically available, because this degrades performance. As a guideline, assuming no other memory intensive processes are running, do not allocate more than 2/3 of the available memory.

parameter.name: maxPermGen
parameter.description: Specifies the maximum permanent space size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The permanent space is allocated as a separate memory region from the java heap, so increasing the permanent space will increase the overall memory requirements for the process.

parameter.name: minHeap
parameter.description: Specifies the initial and minimum heap size of JVM which runs Fortify SCA. The default value is 300MB (-Xms300M), which can be sufficient in most of cases.

parameter.name: projectId
parameter.description: Project ID of the project in Software Security Center used if upload is set to true. Note that projectId will override projectName, projectVersion combinations if supplied.

parameter.name: projectName
parameter.description: Project Name of the project in Software Security Center used if upload is set to true. Note that this must be supplied in conjunction with projectVersion.

parameter.name: projectVersion
parameter.description: Project Version of the project in Software Security Center used if upload is set to true. Note that this must be supplied in conjunction with projectName.

parameter.name: quiet
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will write minimal messages to the console

parameter.name: resultsFile
parameter.description: Location and name of the generated FPR file to upload

parameter.name: scanEnabled
parameter.description: Set scanEnabled to false for any project that should not be scanned.

parameter.name: scaPropertiesFile
parameter.description: The location of a .properties file, the contents of which are property-value pairs that are to be passed to sourceanalyzer in the form of -Dproperty=value, e.g. -Dcom.fortify.sca.DefaultJarsDirs=default_jar:../mylibs and -Dcom.fortify.sca.limiters.MaxChainDepth=10. Said file should be a standard Java properties file; refer to the Java documentation for more info on what this entails. Note that properties set in this manner will often take preference over Maven plug-in configuration properties such as defaultJarsPathString.

parameter.name: sourceanalyzer
parameter.description: location of the sourceanalyzer executable. Defaults to sourceanalyzer which will run the version on the path or fail if non exists.

parameter.name: stackSize
parameter.description: Specifies the thread stack size of JVM runs Fortify SCA. Thread stacks are memory areas allocated for each Java thread for their internal use. The defaul value is 1MB (-Xss1M), which can be insufficient for large code bases. When encountering java.lang.StackOverflowError, increase the value gradually. For example, -Xss4M, -Xss8M.

parameter.name: verbose
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will sends verbose status messages to the console.

parameter.name: version
parameter.description: If true sourceanalyzer will print its version
